        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      NOTE<span class="line"><!---->NOTE<!----></span><br>This issue is reopening of <span class="line"><!---->This issue is reopening of <!----></span>Issue 1451292<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1451292" title="Security: Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u"><!---->Issue 1451292<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>since the issue is not fully fixed. Cases with MIPS64 is not fixed.<span class="line"><!---->since the issue is not fully fixed. Cases with MIPS64 is not fixed.<!----></span><br>For devs, I'm reopening the issue as a security bug since <span class="line"><!---->For devs, I'm reopening the issue as a security bug since <!----></span>Issue 1451292<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1451292" title="Security: Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u"><!---->Issue 1451292<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>is not open to public. Please downgrade the bug to Type: Bug.<span class="line"><!---->is not open to public. Please downgrade the bug to Type: Bug.<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after div_u and rem_u, resulting in inconsistencies in execution results.<span class="line"><!---->Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after div_u and rem_u, resulting in inconsistencies in execution results.<!----></span><br><br>Sign-extension instructions are missing in the compilation result, so i64.extend_i32_s take no effect on the execution results. The returned values are zero-extended values instead of sign-extended values.<span class="line"><!---->Sign-extension instructions are missing in the compilation result, so i64.extend_i32_s take no effect on the execution results. The returned values are zero-extended values instead of sign-extended values.<!----></span><br><br>For an example, we consider `[local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]` case. Then, we get the following compilation result.<span class="line"><!---->For an example, we consider `[local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]` case. Then, we get the following compilation result.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>(...)<span class="line"><!---->(...)<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09c8    28  00c7001b       divu    a2, a3<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09c8    28  00c7001b       divu    a2, a3<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09cc    2c  00003012       mflo    a2<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09cc    2c  00003012       mflo    a2<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09d0    30  00e7300a       movz    a2, a3, a3<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09d0    30  00e7300a       movz    a2, a3, a3<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09d4    34  00c01025       mov     v0, a2<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09d4    34  00c01025       mov     v0, a2<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09d8    38  03c0e825       mov     sp, fp<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09d8    38  03c0e825       mov     sp, fp<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09dc    3c  dfbe0000       ld      fp, 0(sp)<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09dc    3c  dfbe0000       ld      fp, 0(sp)<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09e0    40  dfbf0008       ld      ra, 8(sp)<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09e0    40  dfbf0008       ld      ra, 8(sp)<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09e4    44  67bd0010       daddiu  sp, sp, 16<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09e4    44  67bd0010       daddiu  sp, sp, 16<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09e8    48  03e00008       jr      ra<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09e8    48  03e00008       jr      ra<!----></span><br>(...)<span class="line"><!---->(...)<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After divu and mflo instructions, no sign-extension instruction exist. Therefore, the value is returned as a zero-extended value.<span class="line"><!---->After divu and mflo instructions, no sign-extension instruction exist. Therefore, the value is returned as a zero-extended value.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Tested on V8 MIPS64 (Simulator build) main commit `<span class="line"><!---->Tested on V8 MIPS64 (Simulator build) main commit `<!----></span>a81fcea0e3ce176da6c9d70f9e47ea9b4811d43e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a81fcea0e3ce176da6c9d70f9e47ea9b4811d43e"><!---->a81fcea0e3ce176da6c9d70f9e47ea9b4811d43e<!----></a>`<span class="line"><!---->`<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<span class="line"><!---->1. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<!----></span><br><br>```wat<span class="line"><!---->```wat<!----></span><br>(module<span class="line"><!---->(module<!----></span><br>  (type (;0;) (func (param i32 i32) (result i64)))<span class="line"><!---->  (type (;0;) (func (param i32 i32) (result i64)))<!----></span><br>  (import "mem" "mem" (memory (;0;) 1024))<span class="line"><!---->  (import "mem" "mem" (memory (;0;) 1024))<!----></span><br>  (func (;0;) (type 0) (param i32 i32) (result i64)<span class="line"><!---->  (func (;0;) (type 0) (param i32 i32) (result i64)<!----></span><br>    local.get 0<span class="line"><!---->    local.get 0<!----></span><br>    local.get 1<span class="line"><!---->    local.get 1<!----></span><br>    i32.div_u<span class="line"><!---->    i32.div_u<!----></span><br>    i64.extend_i32_s)<span class="line"><!---->    i64.extend_i32_s)<!----></span><br>  (export "main" (func 0)))<span class="line"><!---->  (export "main" (func 0)))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```js<span class="line"><!---->```js<!----></span><br>const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,110,172,11,11,1,0]);<span class="line"><!---->const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,110,172,11,11,1,0]);<!----></span><br><br>let memory = new WebAssembly.Memory({<span class="line"><!---->let memory = new WebAssembly.Memory({<!----></span><br>    initial: 1024<span class="line"><!---->    initial: 1024<!----></span><br>})<span class="line"><!---->})<!----></span><br>const module = new WebAssembly.Module(code);<span class="line"><!---->const module = new WebAssembly.Module(code);<!----></span><br>const instance = new WebAssembly.Instance(module, {<span class="line"><!---->const instance = new WebAssembly.Instance(module, {<!----></span><br>    mem: {<span class="line"><!---->    mem: {<!----></span><br>        mem: memory<span class="line"><!---->        mem: memory<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->print(instance.exports.main(-1,1));<!----></span><br>print(instance.exports.main(-2147483648,1));<span class="line"><!---->print(instance.exports.main(-2147483648,1));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc.js<!----></span><br>4294967295<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Expected values are -1 and -2147483648.<span class="line"><!---->Expected values are -1 and -2147483648.<!----></span><br><br>2. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.rem_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<span class="line"><!---->2. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.rem_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<!----></span><br><br>```wat<span class="line"><!---->```wat<!----></span><br>(module<span class="line"><!---->(module<!----></span><br>         I'm not sure this is a security bug; it seems like a miscalculation, which is a functional bug. As far as I know, this is also not a officially-supported platform. I'm taking this out of the security queue and CCing the same people that were initially added to <span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure this is a security bug; it seems like a miscalculation, which is a functional bug. As far as I know, this is also not a officially-supported platform. I'm taking this out of the security queue and CCing the same people that were initially added to <!----></span>issue 1451292<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1451292" title="Security: Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u"><!---->issue 1451292<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1454668#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        Sure. Here's more detailed description about the issue.<span class="line"><!---->Sure. Here's more detailed description about the issue.<!----></span><br><br>```bash<span class="line"><!---->```bash<!----></span><br>$ tools/dev/gm.py mips64el.release<span class="line"><!---->$ tools/dev/gm.py mips64el.release<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc1.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc1.js<!----></span><br>-1<span class="line"><!---->-1<!----></span><br>-2147483648<span class="line"><!---->-2147483648<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc1.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc1.js<!----></span><br>4294967295<span class="line"><!---->4294967295<!----></span><br>2147483648<span class="line"><!---->2147483648<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc2.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc2.js<!----></span><br>-2147483648<span class="line"><!---->-2147483648<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc2.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc2.js<!----></span><br>2147483648<span class="line"><!---->2147483648<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>> I was able to reproduce the issue on the latest commit. (<span class="line"><!---->&gt; I was able to reproduce the issue on the latest commit. (<!----></span>4c6908c33ceecba30454e32971baee94fe4c3c37<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4c6908c33ceecba30454e32971baee94fe4c3c37"><!---->4c6908c33ceecba30454e32971baee94fe4c3c37<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Different results from non-optimizing compiler and optimizing compiler mean optimization is done wrong. Details about what is wrong are in the "VULNERABILITY DETAILS" section.<span class="line"><!---->Different results from non-optimizing compiler and optimizing compiler mean optimization is done wrong. Details about what is wrong are in the "VULNERABILITY DETAILS" section.<!----></span><br><br>You might think that this differing results are not problematic since the values are same when they are represented as uint32 values. (-1 and 4294967295 have same bit representation in 32-bit) But they are actually different since the return type is i64. You can check this with the following example (using poc1.js):<span class="line"><!---->You might think that this differing results are not problematic since the values are same when they are represented as uint32 values. (-1 and 4294967295 have same bit representation in 32-bit) But they are actually different since the return type is i64. You can check this with the following example (using poc1.js):<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,110,172,11,11,1,0]);<span class="line"><!---->const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,110,172,11,11,1,0]);<!----></span><br><br>let memory = new WebAssembly.Memory({<span class="line"><!---->let memory = new WebAssembly.Memory({<!----></span><br>    initial: 1024<span class="line"><!---->    initial: 1024<!----></span><br>})<span class="line"><!---->})<!----></span><br>const module = new WebAssembly.Module(code);<span class="line"><!---->const module = new WebAssembly.Module(code);<!----></span><br>const instance = new WebAssembly.Instance(module, {<span class="line"><!---->const instance = new WebAssembly.Instance(module, {<!----></span><br>    mem: {<span class="line"><!---->    mem: {<!----></span><br>        mem: memory<span class="line"><!---->        mem: memory<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br><br>print(Object.is(4294967295n, instance.exports.main(-1,1)));<span class="line"><!---->print(Object.is(4294967295n, instance.exports.main(-1,1)));<!----></span><br>print(Object.is(2147483648n, instance.exports.main(-2147483648,1)));<span class="line"><!---->print(Object.is(2147483648n, instance.exports.main(-2147483648,1)));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc1_modified.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc1_modified.js<!----></span><br>false<span class="line"><!---->false<!----></span><br>false<span class="line"><!---->false<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc1_modified.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc1_modified.js<!----></span><br>true<span class="line"><!---->true<!----></span><br>true<span class="line"><!---->true<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>If you need more information, feel free to ask.<span class="line"><!---->If you need more information, feel free to ask.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1454668#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jun 25, 2023, 5:52 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1454668#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jun 25, 2023, 5:52 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        This is actually a simulator issue；<span class="line"><!---->This is actually a simulator issue；<!----></span><br>According to MIPS ISA, the result of divu should be sign-extended, so i64.extend_i32_s can be omitted in TurboFan.<span class="line"><!---->According to MIPS ISA, the result of divu should be sign-extended, so i64.extend_i32_s can be omitted in TurboFan.<!----></span><br>But in simulator, the result of divu is of uint32, and put into a register without sign extended, which causes an error.<span class="line"><!---->But in simulator, the result of divu is of uint32, and put into a register without sign extended, which causes an error.<!----></span><br>So I converted the result to int32 , and implement sign extension on implicit conversion to int64 in set_register.<span class="line"><!---->So I converted the result to int32 , and implement sign extension on implicit conversion to int64 in set_register.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }

          height: 1px;

            Comment: <label for="commentContent">Comment: </label>

            <span></span>
            
       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      NOTE<span class="line"><!---->NOTE<!----></span><br>This issue is reopening of <span class="line"><!---->This issue is reopening of <!----></span>Issue 1451292<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1451292" title="Security: Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u"><!---->Issue 1451292<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>since the issue is not fully fixed. Cases with MIPS64 is not fixed.<span class="line"><!---->since the issue is not fully fixed. Cases with MIPS64 is not fixed.<!----></span><br>For devs, I'm reopening the issue as a security bug since <span class="line"><!---->For devs, I'm reopening the issue as a security bug since <!----></span>Issue 1451292<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1451292" title="Security: Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u"><!---->Issue 1451292<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>is not open to public. Please downgrade the bug to Type: Bug.<span class="line"><!---->is not open to public. Please downgrade the bug to Type: Bug.<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after div_u and rem_u, resulting in inconsistencies in execution results.<span class="line"><!---->Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after div_u and rem_u, resulting in inconsistencies in execution results.<!----></span><br><br>Sign-extension instructions are missing in the compilation result, so i64.extend_i32_s take no effect on the execution results. The returned values are zero-extended values instead of sign-extended values.<span class="line"><!---->Sign-extension instructions are missing in the compilation result, so i64.extend_i32_s take no effect on the execution results. The returned values are zero-extended values instead of sign-extended values.<!----></span><br><br>For an example, we consider `[local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]` case. Then, we get the following compilation result.<span class="line"><!---->For an example, we consider `[local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]` case. Then, we get the following compilation result.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>(...)<span class="line"><!---->(...)<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09c8    28  00c7001b       divu    a2, a3<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09c8    28  00c7001b       divu    a2, a3<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09cc    2c  00003012       mflo    a2<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09cc    2c  00003012       mflo    a2<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09d0    30  00e7300a       movz    a2, a3, a3<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09d0    30  00e7300a       movz    a2, a3, a3<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09d4    34  00c01025       mov     v0, a2<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09d4    34  00c01025       mov     v0, a2<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09d8    38  03c0e825       mov     sp, fp<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09d8    38  03c0e825       mov     sp, fp<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09dc    3c  dfbe0000       ld      fp, 0(sp)<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09dc    3c  dfbe0000       ld      fp, 0(sp)<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09e0    40  dfbf0008       ld      ra, 8(sp)<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09e0    40  dfbf0008       ld      ra, 8(sp)<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09e4    44  67bd0010       daddiu  sp, sp, 16<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09e4    44  67bd0010       daddiu  sp, sp, 16<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09e8    48  03e00008       jr      ra<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09e8    48  03e00008       jr      ra<!----></span><br>(...)<span class="line"><!---->(...)<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After divu and mflo instructions, no sign-extension instruction exist. Therefore, the value is returned as a zero-extended value.<span class="line"><!---->After divu and mflo instructions, no sign-extension instruction exist. Therefore, the value is returned as a zero-extended value.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Tested on V8 MIPS64 (Simulator build) main commit `<span class="line"><!---->Tested on V8 MIPS64 (Simulator build) main commit `<!----></span>a81fcea0e3ce176da6c9d70f9e47ea9b4811d43e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a81fcea0e3ce176da6c9d70f9e47ea9b4811d43e"><!---->a81fcea0e3ce176da6c9d70f9e47ea9b4811d43e<!----></a>`<span class="line"><!---->`<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<span class="line"><!---->1. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<!----></span><br><br>```wat<span class="line"><!---->```wat<!----></span><br>(module<span class="line"><!---->(module<!----></span><br>  (type (;0;) (func (param i32 i32) (result i64)))<span class="line"><!---->  (type (;0;) (func (param i32 i32) (result i64)))<!----></span><br>  (import "mem" "mem" (memory (;0;) 1024))<span class="line"><!---->  (import "mem" "mem" (memory (;0;) 1024))<!----></span><br>  (func (;0;) (type 0) (param i32 i32) (result i64)<span class="line"><!---->  (func (;0;) (type 0) (param i32 i32) (result i64)<!----></span><br>    local.get 0<span class="line"><!---->    local.get 0<!----></span><br>    local.get 1<span class="line"><!---->    local.get 1<!----></span><br>    i32.div_u<span class="line"><!---->    i32.div_u<!----></span><br>    i64.extend_i32_s)<span class="line"><!---->    i64.extend_i32_s)<!----></span><br>  (export "main" (func 0)))<span class="line"><!---->  (export "main" (func 0)))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```js<span class="line"><!---->```js<!----></span><br>const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,110,172,11,11,1,0]);<span class="line"><!---->const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,110,172,11,11,1,0]);<!----></span><br><br>let memory = new WebAssembly.Memory({<span class="line"><!---->let memory = new WebAssembly.Memory({<!----></span><br>    initial: 1024<span class="line"><!---->    initial: 1024<!----></span><br>})<span class="line"><!---->})<!----></span><br>const module = new WebAssembly.Module(code);<span class="line"><!---->const module = new WebAssembly.Module(code);<!----></span><br>const instance = new WebAssembly.Instance(module, {<span class="line"><!---->const instance = new WebAssembly.Instance(module, {<!----></span><br>    mem: {<span class="line"><!---->    mem: {<!----></span><br>        mem: memory<span class="line"><!---->        mem: memory<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br><br>print(instance.exports.main(-1,1));<span class="line"><!---->print(instance.exports.main(-1,1));<!----></span><br>print(instance.exports.main(-2147483648,1));<span class="line"><!---->print(instance.exports.main(-2147483648,1));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc.js<!----></span><br>4294967295<span class="line"><!---->4294967295<!----></span><br>2147483648<span class="line"><!---->2147483648<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc.js<!----></span><br>-1<span class="line"><!---->-1<!----></span><br>-2147483648<span class="line"><!---->-2147483648<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Expected values are -1 and -2147483648.<span class="line"><!---->Expected values are -1 and -2147483648.<!----></span><br><br>2. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.rem_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<span class="line"><!---->2. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.rem_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<!----></span><br><br>```wat<span class="line"><!---->```wat<!----></span><br>(module<span class="line"><!---->(module<!----></span><br>         I'm not sure this is a security bug; it seems like a miscalculation, which is a functional bug. As far as I know, this is also not a officially-supported platform. I'm taking this out of the security queue and CCing the same people that were initially added to <span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure this is a security bug; it seems like a miscalculation, which is a functional bug. As far as I know, this is also not a officially-supported platform. I'm taking this out of the security queue and CCing the same people that were initially added to <!----></span>issue 1451292<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1451292" title="Security: Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u"><!---->issue 1451292<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Here's more detailed description about the issue.<!----></span><br><br>```bash<span class="line"><!---->```bash<!----></span><br>$ tools/dev/gm.py mips64el.release<span class="line"><!---->$ tools/dev/gm.py mips64el.release<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc1.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc1.js<!----></span><br>-1<span class="line"><!---->-1<!----></span><br>-2147483648<span class="line"><!---->-2147483648<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc1.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc1.js<!----></span><br>4294967295<span class="line"><!---->4294967295<!----></span><br>2147483648<span class="line"><!---->2147483648<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc2.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc2.js<!----></span><br>-2147483648<span class="line"><!---->-2147483648<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc2.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc2.js<!----></span><br>2147483648<span class="line"><!---->2147483648<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>> I was able to reproduce the issue on the latest commit. (<span class="line"><!---->&gt; I was able to reproduce the issue on the latest commit. (<!----></span>4c6908c33ceecba30454e32971baee94fe4c3c37<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4c6908c33ceecba30454e32971baee94fe4c3c37"><!---->4c6908c33ceecba30454e32971baee94fe4c3c37<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Different results from non-optimizing compiler and optimizing compiler mean optimization is done wrong. Details about what is wrong are in the "VULNERABILITY DETAILS" section.<span class="line"><!---->Different results from non-optimizing compiler and optimizing compiler mean optimization is done wrong. Details about what is wrong are in the "VULNERABILITY DETAILS" section.<!----></span><br><br>You might think that this differing results are not problematic since the values are same when they are represented as uint32 values. (-1 and 4294967295 have same bit representation in 32-bit) But they are actually different since the return type is i64. You can check this with the following example (using poc1.js):<span class="line"><!---->You might think that this differing results are not problematic since the values are same when they are represented as uint32 values. (-1 and 4294967295 have same bit representation in 32-bit) But they are actually different since the return type is i64. You can check this with the following example (using poc1.js):<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,110,172,11,11,1,0]);<span class="line"><!---->const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,110,172,11,11,1,0]);<!----></span><br><br>let memory = new WebAssembly.Memory({<span class="line"><!---->let memory = new WebAssembly.Memory({<!----></span><br>    initial: 1024<span class="line"><!---->    initial: 1024<!----></span><br>})<span class="line"><!---->})<!----></span><br>const module = new WebAssembly.Module(code);<span class="line"><!---->const module = new WebAssembly.Module(code);<!----></span><br>const instance = new WebAssembly.Instance(module, {<span class="line"><!---->const instance = new WebAssembly.Instance(module, {<!----></span><br>    mem: {<span class="line"><!---->    mem: {<!----></span><br>        mem: memory<span class="line"><!---->        mem: memory<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br><br>print(Object.is(4294967295n, instance.exports.main(-1,1)));<span class="line"><!---->print(Object.is(4294967295n, instance.exports.main(-1,1)));<!----></span><br>print(Object.is(2147483648n, instance.exports.main(-2147483648,1)));<span class="line"><!---->print(Object.is(2147483648n, instance.exports.main(-2147483648,1)));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc1_modified.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc1_modified.js<!----></span><br>false<span class="line"><!---->false<!----></span><br>false<span class="line"><!---->false<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc1_modified.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc1_modified.js<!----></span><br>true<span class="line"><!---->true<!----></span><br>true<span class="line"><!---->true<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>If you need more information, feel free to ask.<span class="line"><!---->If you need more information, feel free to ask.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 17<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1454668#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1454668#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jun 25, 2023, 5:52 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1454668#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jun 25, 2023, 5:52 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        This is actually a simulator issue；<span class="line"><!---->This is actually a simulator issue；<!----></span><br>According to MIPS ISA, the result of divu should be sign-extended, so i64.extend_i32_s can be omitted in TurboFan.<span class="line"><!---->According to MIPS ISA, the result of divu should be sign-extended, so i64.extend_i32_s can be omitted in TurboFan.<!----></span><br>But in simulator, the result of divu is of uint32, and put into a register without sign extended, which causes an error.<span class="line"><!---->But in simulator, the result of divu is of uint32, and put into a register without sign extended, which causes an error.<!----></span><br>So I converted the result to int32 , and implement sign extension on implicit conversion to int64 in set_register.<span class="line"><!---->So I converted the result to int32 , and implement sign extension on implicit conversion to int64 in set_register.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

            Issue 1454668: [mips64][turbofan] Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u (Reopening of Issue 1451292)
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1454668: [mips64][turbofan] Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u (Reopening of Issue 1451292)
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      candy...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/4044982720" title="candy...@gmail.com"><!---->candy...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      candy...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->candy...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 9:30 PM EDT

      NOTE<span class="line"><!---->NOTE<!----></span><br>This issue is reopening of <span class="line"><!---->This issue is reopening of <!----></span>Issue 1451292<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1451292" title="Security: Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u"><!---->Issue 1451292<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>since the issue is not fully fixed. Cases with MIPS64 is not fixed.<span class="line"><!---->since the issue is not fully fixed. Cases with MIPS64 is not fixed.<!----></span><br>For devs, I'm reopening the issue as a security bug since <span class="line"><!---->For devs, I'm reopening the issue as a security bug since <!----></span>Issue 1451292<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1451292" title="Security: Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u"><!---->Issue 1451292<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>is not open to public. Please downgrade the bug to Type: Bug.<span class="line"><!---->is not open to public. Please downgrade the bug to Type: Bug.<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after div_u and rem_u, resulting in inconsistencies in execution results.<span class="line"><!---->Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after div_u and rem_u, resulting in inconsistencies in execution results.<!----></span><br><br>Sign-extension instructions are missing in the compilation result, so i64.extend_i32_s take no effect on the execution results. The returned values are zero-extended values instead of sign-extended values.<span class="line"><!---->Sign-extension instructions are missing in the compilation result, so i64.extend_i32_s take no effect on the execution results. The returned values are zero-extended values instead of sign-extended values.<!----></span><br><br>For an example, we consider `[local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]` case. Then, we get the following compilation result.<span class="line"><!---->For an example, we consider `[local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]` case. Then, we get the following compilation result.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>(...)<span class="line"><!---->(...)<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09c8    28  00c7001b       divu    a2, a3<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09c8    28  00c7001b       divu    a2, a3<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09cc    2c  00003012       mflo    a2<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09cc    2c  00003012       mflo    a2<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09d0    30  00e7300a       movz    a2, a3, a3<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09d0    30  00e7300a       movz    a2, a3, a3<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09d4    34  00c01025       mov     v0, a2<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09d4    34  00c01025       mov     v0, a2<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09d8    38  03c0e825       mov     sp, fp<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09d8    38  03c0e825       mov     sp, fp<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09dc    3c  dfbe0000       ld      fp, 0(sp)<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09dc    3c  dfbe0000       ld      fp, 0(sp)<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09e0    40  dfbf0008       ld      ra, 8(sp)<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09e0    40  dfbf0008       ld      ra, 8(sp)<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09e4    44  67bd0010       daddiu  sp, sp, 16<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09e4    44  67bd0010       daddiu  sp, sp, 16<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09e8    48  03e00008       jr      ra<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09e8    48  03e00008       jr      ra<!----></span><br>(...)<span class="line"><!---->(...)<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After divu and mflo instructions, no sign-extension instruction exist. Therefore, the value is returned as a zero-extended value.<span class="line"><!---->After divu and mflo instructions, no sign-extension instruction exist. Therefore, the value is returned as a zero-extended value.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Tested on V8 MIPS64 (Simulator build) main commit `<span class="line"><!---->Tested on V8 MIPS64 (Simulator build) main commit `<!----></span>a81fcea0e3ce176da6c9d70f9e47ea9b4811d43e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a81fcea0e3ce176da6c9d70f9e47ea9b4811d43e"><!---->a81fcea0e3ce176da6c9d70f9e47ea9b4811d43e<!----></a>`<span class="line"><!---->`<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<span class="line"><!---->1. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<!----></span><br><br>```wat<span class="line"><!---->```wat<!----></span><br>(module<span class="line"><!---->(module<!----></span><br>  (type (;0;) (func (param i32 i32) (result i64)))<span class="line"><!---->  (type (;0;) (func (param i32 i32) (result i64)))<!----></span><br>  (import "mem" "mem" (memory (;0;) 1024))<span class="line"><!---->  (import "mem" "mem" (memory (;0;) 1024))<!----></span><br>  (func (;0;) (type 0) (param i32 i32) (result i64)<span class="line"><!---->  (func (;0;) (type 0) (param i32 i32) (result i64)<!----></span><br>    local.get 0<span class="line"><!---->    local.get 0<!----></span><br>    local.get 1<span class="line"><!---->    local.get 1<!----></span><br>    i32.div_u<span class="line"><!---->    i32.div_u<!----></span><br>    i64.extend_i32_s)<span class="line"><!---->    i64.extend_i32_s)<!----></span><br>  (export "main" (func 0)))<span class="line"><!---->  (export "main" (func 0)))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```js<span class="line"><!---->```js<!----></span><br>const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,110,172,11,11,1,0]);<span class="line"><!---->const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,110,172,11,11,1,0]);<!----></span><br><br>let memory = new WebAssembly.Memory({<span class="line"><!---->let memory = new WebAssembly.Memory({<!----></span><br>    initial: 1024<span class="line"><!---->    initial: 1024<!----></span><br>})<span class="line"><!---->})<!----></span><br>const module = new WebAssembly.Module(code);<span class="line"><!---->const module = new WebAssembly.Module(code);<!----></span><br>const instance = new WebAssembly.Instance(module, {<span class="line"><!---->const instance = new WebAssembly.Instance(module, {<!----></span><br>    mem: {<span class="line"><!---->    mem: {<!----></span><br>        mem: memory<span class="line"><!---->        mem: memory<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br><br>print(instance.exports.main(-1,1));<span class="line"><!---->print(instance.exports.main(-1,1));<!----></span><br>print(instance.exports.main(-2147483648,1));<span class="line"><!---->print(instance.exports.main(-2147483648,1));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc.js<!----></span><br>4294967295<span class="line"><!---->4294967295<!----></span><br>2147483648<span class="line"><!---->2147483648<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc.js<!----></span><br>-1<span class="line"><!---->-1<!----></span><br>-2147483648<span class="line"><!---->-2147483648<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Expected values are -1 and -2147483648.<span class="line"><!---->Expected values are -1 and -2147483648.<!----></span><br><br>2. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.rem_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<span class="line"><!---->2. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.rem_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<!----></span><br><br>```wat<span class="line"><!---->```wat<!----></span><br>(module<span class="line"><!---->(module<!----></span><br>  (type (;0;) (func (param i32 i32) (result i64)))<span class="line"><!---->  (type (;0;) (func (param i32 i32) (result i64)))<!----></span><br>  (import "mem" "mem" (memory (;0;) 1024))<span class="line"><!---->  (import "mem" "mem" (memory (;0;) 1024))<!----></span><br>  (func (;0;) (type 0) (param i32 i32) (result i64)<span class="line"><!---->  (func (;0;) (type 0) (param i32 i32) (result i64)<!----></span><br>    local.get 0<span class="line"><!---->    local.get 0<!----></span><br>    local.get 1<span class="line"><!---->    local.get 1<!----></span><br>    i32.rem_u<span class="line"><!---->    i32.rem_u<!----></span><br>    i64.extend_i32_s)<span class="line"><!---->    i64.extend_i32_s)<!----></span><br>  (export "main" (func 0)))<span class="line"><!---->  (export "main" (func 0)))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```js<span class="line"><!---->```js<!----></span><br>const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,112,172,11,11,1,0]);<span class="line"><!---->const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,112,172,11,11,1,0]);<!----></span><br><br>let           Comment 8<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1454668#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      candy...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/4044982720" title="candy...@gmail.com"><!---->candy...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      candy...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->candy...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

      Mon, Jun 19, 2023, 6:16 AM EDT

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1454668#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 19, 2023, 6:16 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1454668#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 19, 2023, 6:16 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Sure. Here's more detailed description about the issue.<span class="line"><!---->Sure. Here's more detailed description about the issue.<!----></span><br><br>```bash<span class="line"><!---->```bash<!----></span><br>$ tools/dev/gm.py mips64el.release<span class="line"><!---->$ tools/dev/gm.py mips64el.release<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc1.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc1.js<!----></span><br>-1<span class="line"><!---->-1<!----></span><br>-2147483648<span class="line"><!---->-2147483648<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc1.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc1.js<!----></span><br>4294967295<span class="line"><!---->4294967295<!----></span><br>2147483648<span class="line"><!---->2147483648<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc2.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc2.js<!----></span><br>-2147483648<span class="line"><!---->-2147483648<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc2.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc2.js<!----></span><br>2147483648<span class="line"><!---->2147483648<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>> I was able to reproduce the issue on the latest commit. (<span class="line"><!---->&gt; I was able to reproduce the issue on the latest commit. (<!----></span>4c6908c33ceecba30454e32971baee94fe4c3c37<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4c6908c33ceecba30454e32971baee94fe4c3c37"><!---->4c6908c33ceecba30454e32971baee94fe4c3c37<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Different results from non-optimizing compiler and optimizing compiler mean optimization is done wrong. Details about what is wrong are in the "VULNERABILITY DETAILS" section.<span class="line"><!---->Different results from non-optimizing compiler and optimizing compiler mean optimization is done wrong. Details about what is wrong are in the "VULNERABILITY DETAILS" section.<!----></span><br><br>You might think that this differing results are not problematic since the values are same when they are represented as uint32 values. (-1 and 4294967295 have same bit representation in 32-bit) But they are actually different since the return type is i64. You can check this with the following example (using poc1.js):<span class="line"><!---->You might think that this differing results are not problematic since the values are same when they are represented as uint32 values. (-1 and 4294967295 have same bit representation in 32-bit) But they are actually different since the return type is i64. You can check this with the following example (using poc1.js):<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,110,172,11,11,1,0]);<span class="line"><!---->const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,110,172,11,11,1,0]);<!----></span><br><br>let memory = new WebAssembly.Memory({<span class="line"><!---->let memory = new WebAssembly.Memory({<!----></span><br>    initial: 1024<span class="line"><!---->    initial: 1024<!----></span><br>})<span class="line"><!---->})<!----></span><br>const module = new WebAssembly.Module(code);<span class="line"><!---->const module = new WebAssembly.Module(code);<!----></span><br>const instance = new WebAssembly.Instance(module, {<span class="line"><!---->const instance = new WebAssembly.Instance(module, {<!----></span><br>    mem: {<span class="line"><!---->    mem: {<!----></span><br>        mem: memory<span class="line"><!---->        mem: memory<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br><br>print(Object.is(4294967295n, instance.exports.main(-1,1)));<span class="line"><!---->print(Object.is(4294967295n, instance.exports.main(-1,1)));<!----></span><br>print(Object.is(2147483648n, instance.exports.main(-2147483648,1)));<span class="line"><!---->print(Object.is(2147483648n, instance.exports.main(-2147483648,1)));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc1_modified.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc1_modified.js<!----></span><br>false<span class="line"><!---->false<!----></span><br>false<span class="line"><!---->false<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc1_modified.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc1_modified.js<!----></span><br>true<span class="line"><!---->true<!----></span><br>true<span class="line"><!---->true<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>If you need more information, feel free to ask.<span class="line"><!---->If you need more information, feel free to ask.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 17<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1454668#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      Sun, Jun 25, 2023, 5:52 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jun 25, 2023, 5:52 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1454668#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jun 25, 2023, 5:52 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1454668#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jun 25, 2023, 5:52 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        This is actually a simulator issue；<span class="line"><!---->This is actually a simulator issue；<!----></span><br>According to MIPS ISA, the result of divu should be sign-extended, so i64.extend_i32_s can be omitted in TurboFan.<span class="line"><!---->According to MIPS ISA, the result of divu should be sign-extended, so i64.extend_i32_s can be omitted in TurboFan.<!----></span><br>But in simulator, the result of divu is of uint32, and put into a register without sign extended, which causes an error.<span class="line"><!---->But in simulator, the result of divu is of uint32, and put into a register without sign extended, which causes an error.<!----></span><br>So I converted the result to int32 , and implement sign extension on implicit conversion to int64 in set_register.<span class="line"><!---->So I converted the result to int32 , and implement sign extension on implicit conversion to int64 in set_register.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

            Issue 1454668: [mips64][turbofan] Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u (Reopening of Issue 1451292)
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1454668: [mips64][turbofan] Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u (Reopening of Issue 1451292)
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      candy...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/4044982720" title="candy...@gmail.com"><!---->candy...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      candy...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->candy...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 9:30 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 9:30 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 9:30 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1454668: [mips64][turbofan] Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u (Reopening of Issue 1451292)
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 9:30 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1454668: [mips64][turbofan] Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u (Reopening of Issue 1451292)
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">

      NOTE<span class="line"><!---->NOTE<!----></span><br>This issue is reopening of <span class="line"><!---->This issue is reopening of <!----></span>Issue 1451292<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1451292" title="Security: Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u"><!---->Issue 1451292<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>since the issue is not fully fixed. Cases with MIPS64 is not fixed.<span class="line"><!---->since the issue is not fully fixed. Cases with MIPS64 is not fixed.<!----></span><br>For devs, I'm reopening the issue as a security bug since <span class="line"><!---->For devs, I'm reopening the issue as a security bug since <!----></span>Issue 1451292<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1451292" title="Security: Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after WASM div_u and rem_u"><!---->Issue 1451292<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>is not open to public. Please downgrade the bug to Type: Bug.<span class="line"><!---->is not open to public. Please downgrade the bug to Type: Bug.<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after div_u and rem_u, resulting in inconsistencies in execution results.<span class="line"><!---->Turbofan wrongly removes sign-extensions after div_u and rem_u, resulting in inconsistencies in execution results.<!----></span><br><br>Sign-extension instructions are missing in the compilation result, so i64.extend_i32_s take no effect on the execution results. The returned values are zero-extended values instead of sign-extended values.<span class="line"><!---->Sign-extension instructions are missing in the compilation result, so i64.extend_i32_s take no effect on the execution results. The returned values are zero-extended values instead of sign-extended values.<!----></span><br><br>For an example, we consider `[local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]` case. Then, we get the following compilation result.<span class="line"><!---->For an example, we consider `[local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]` case. Then, we get the following compilation result.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>(...)<span class="line"><!---->(...)<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09c8    28  00c7001b       divu    a2, a3<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09c8    28  00c7001b       divu    a2, a3<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09cc    2c  00003012       mflo    a2<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09cc    2c  00003012       mflo    a2<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09d0    30  00e7300a       movz    a2, a3, a3<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09d0    30  00e7300a       movz    a2, a3, a3<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09d4    34  00c01025       mov     v0, a2<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09d4    34  00c01025       mov     v0, a2<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09d8    38  03c0e825       mov     sp, fp<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09d8    38  03c0e825       mov     sp, fp<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09dc    3c  dfbe0000       ld      fp, 0(sp)<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09dc    3c  dfbe0000       ld      fp, 0(sp)<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09e0    40  dfbf0008       ld      ra, 8(sp)<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09e0    40  dfbf0008       ld      ra, 8(sp)<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09e4    44  67bd0010       daddiu  sp, sp, 16<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09e4    44  67bd0010       daddiu  sp, sp, 16<!----></span><br>0xd6c0fe09e8    48  03e00008       jr      ra<span class="line"><!---->0xd6c0fe09e8    48  03e00008       jr      ra<!----></span><br>(...)<span class="line"><!---->(...)<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After divu and mflo instructions, no sign-extension instruction exist. Therefore, the value is returned as a zero-extended value.<span class="line"><!---->After divu and mflo instructions, no sign-extension instruction exist. Therefore, the value is returned as a zero-extended value.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Tested on V8 MIPS64 (Simulator build) main commit `<span class="line"><!---->Tested on V8 MIPS64 (Simulator build) main commit `<!----></span>a81fcea0e3ce176da6c9d70f9e47ea9b4811d43e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a81fcea0e3ce176da6c9d70f9e47ea9b4811d43e"><!---->a81fcea0e3ce176da6c9d70f9e47ea9b4811d43e<!----></a>`<span class="line"><!---->`<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<span class="line"><!---->1. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.div_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<!----></span><br><br>```wat<span class="line"><!---->```wat<!----></span><br>(module<span class="line"><!---->(module<!----></span><br>  (type (;0;) (func (param i32 i32) (result i64)))<span class="line"><!---->  (type (;0;) (func (param i32 i32) (result i64)))<!----></span><br>  (import "mem" "mem" (memory (;0;) 1024))<span class="line"><!---->  (import "mem" "mem" (memory (;0;) 1024))<!----></span><br>  (func (;0;) (type 0) (param i32 i32) (result i64)<span class="line"><!---->  (func (;0;) (type 0) (param i32 i32) (result i64)<!----></span><br>    local.get 0<span class="line"><!---->    local.get 0<!----></span><br>    local.get 1<span class="line"><!---->    local.get 1<!----></span><br>    i32.div_u<span class="line"><!---->    i32.div_u<!----></span><br>    i64.extend_i32_s)<span class="line"><!---->    i64.extend_i32_s)<!----></span><br>  (export "main" (func 0)))<span class="line"><!---->  (export "main" (func 0)))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```js<span class="line"><!---->```js<!----></span><br>const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,110,172,11,11,1,0]);<span class="line"><!---->const code = new Uint8Array([0,97,115,109,1,0,0,0,1,7,1,96,2,127,127,1,126,2,13,1,3,109,101,109,3,109,101,109,2,0,128,8,3,2,1,0,7,8,1,4,109,97,105,110,0,0,10,10,1,8,0,32,0,32,1,110,172,11,11,1,0]);<!----></span><br><br>let memory = new WebAssembly.Memory({<span class="line"><!---->let memory = new WebAssembly.Memory({<!----></span><br>    initial: 1024<span class="line"><!---->    initial: 1024<!----></span><br>})<span class="line"><!---->})<!----></span><br>const module = new WebAssembly.Module(code);<span class="line"><!---->const module = new WebAssembly.Module(code);<!----></span><br>const instance = new WebAssembly.Instance(module, {<span class="line"><!---->const instance = new WebAssembly.Instance(module, {<!----></span><br>    mem: {<span class="line"><!---->    mem: {<!----></span><br>        mem: memory<span class="line"><!---->        mem: memory<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br><br>print(instance.exports.main(-1,1));<span class="line"><!---->print(instance.exports.main(-1,1));<!----></span><br>print(instance.exports.main(-2147483648,1));<span class="line"><!---->print(instance.exports.main(-2147483648,1));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --no-liftoff poc.js<!----></span><br>4294967295<span class="line"><!---->4294967295<!----></span><br>2147483648<span class="line"><!---->2147483648<!----></span><br>$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/mips64el.release/d8 --liftoff poc.js<!----></span><br>-1<span class="line"><!---->-1<!----></span><br>-2147483648<span class="line"><!---->-2147483648<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Expected values are -1 and -2147483648.<span class="line"><!---->Expected values are -1 and -2147483648.<!----></span><br><br>2. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.rem_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<span class="line"><!---->2. [local.get arg] [local.get arg] [i32.rem_u] [i64.extend_i32_s]<!----></span><br><br>```wat<span class="line"><!---->```wat<!----></span><br>(module<span class="line"><!---->(module<!----></span><br>  (type (;0;) (func (param i32 i32) (result i64)))<span class="line"><!---->  (type (;0;) (func (param i32 i32) (result i64)))<!----></span><br>  (import "mem" "mem" (memory (;0;) 1024))<span (result i64)<!----></span><br>    local.get 0<span class="line"><!---->    local.get 0<!----></span><br>    local.get 1<span class="line"><!---->    local.get 1<!----></span><br>    i32.rem_u<span class="line"><!---->    i32.rem_u<!----></span><br>    i64.extend_i32_s)<span class="line"><!---->    i64.extend_i32_s)<!----></span><br>  (export "main" (func 0)))<span class="line"><!---->  (export "main" (func 0)))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```js<span class="line"><!---->```js<!----></span><br>const code = new
